snippet: Sharp divisions are forming between lawmakers who believe the best path to success is through a meticulous legislative process, and those who advocate a more guerrilla approach.
abstract: Sharp divisions are forming among Congressional Democrats over future of gun control, splitting those who support meticulous legislative process from those who advocate more guerrilla approach.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Williamsburg, Va., and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Sharp divisions are forming between lawmakers who believe the best path to success is through a meticulous legislative process, and those who advocate a more guerrilla approach.

headline.seo: Democrats in Congress Split Over Approach to Gun Laws
headline.main: Democrats Are Split Over How to Shape Approach to Gun Bills
headline.print_headline: Democrats Are Split Over How to Shape Approach to Gun Bills
